extends java.lang.Object

    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.EnumGameState
      EnumGameState - Identifies the state of the game
      Running - The game is running
      Win - The game has ended and user win the game
      Lost - The game has ended and user lost the game

      Game(java.util.List<GameMap> boards, EnumGuardType guardType, int numOgres)
      Class Constructor Game that receives the boards to be used in the game, the type of Guard present in first level and number of ogres (and respective Clubs) that are available to play with
      Game(java.util.List<GameMap> boards, int numOgres)
      Class Constructor Game that receives the boards to be used in the game and number of ogres (and respective Clubs) that are available to play with

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GameMap board,
            boolean isTest)
        Class Constructor Game specifying the board to play
        Parameters:
        board - the GameMap board to be used on the game,
        isTest - a boolean to verify if is a game or a unit test on run

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.List<GameMap> boards,
            EnumGuardType guardType,
            int numOgres)
        Class Constructor Game that receives the boards to be used in the game, the type of Guard present in first level and number of ogres (and respective Clubs) that are available to play with
        Parameters:
        boards - List of GameMap boards
        guardType - Identifies if the Guard is Rockie, Drunk or Paranoid
        numOgres - Number of ogres in the current game

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.List<GameMap> boards,
            int numOgres)
        Class Constructor Game that receives the boards to be used in the game and number of ogres (and respective Clubs) that are available to play with
        Parameters:
        boards - List of GameMap boards
        numOgres - Number of ogres in the current game

    • Method Detail

      • setRandomId

        public void setRandomId()
        Change the ID game randomly

      • initGame

        public void initGame()
        Initialize the game and verify if exist Ogres
        If there are ogres on the game - they will take their positions on the map and put the key on board

        If there are not ogres - only the key take its position

      • verifyifIsHero

        public boolean verifyifIsHero(int i,
                              int j)
        Verify if the board has a character 'h' or 'H' that represents the Hero on the position [x][y]
        Parameters:
        i - the x-coordinate
        j - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true if Hero exists or false otherwise

      • initGuard

        public java.util.List<Vilan> initGuard(int i,
                                       int j)
        Adds this specific Guard to Villan's List
        If not choosen, guardType is choose randomly
        Parameters:
        i - the x-coordinate of guard
        j - the y-coordinate of guard
        Returns:
        return Villan's ArrayList with the guard added

      • initOgresList

        public void initOgresList(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> x_ogres,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> y_ogres,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> x_clubs,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> y_clubs)
        Add various ogres and their respective clubs to Villan's ArrayList
        Parameters:
        x_ogres - List with x-coordinate of each ogre
        y_ogres - List with y-coordinate of each ogre
        x_clubs - List with x-cooydinate of each club
        y_clubs - List with y-coordinate of each club

      • initOgres

        public void initOgres(int x_ogre,
                      int y_ogre,
                      int x_club,
                      int y_club)
        Add one ogre and his club to the Villans' ArrayList according their coordinates
        If number of ogres is not defined - it will be randomly calculated
        Parameters:
        x_ogre - x-coordinate of ogre
        y_ogre - y-coordinate of ogre
        x_club - x-coordinate of club
        y_club - y-coordinate of club

      • setGuardPath

        public void setGuardPath(int[] x,
                         int[] y)
        Set guard's path with predifined positions
        Parameters:
        x - int[] with x-coordinates of the guard
        y - int[] with y-coordinates of the guard
